title: PARALLEL STROKES
content:
My new book, [Parallel Strokes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/parallelstrokes.com/), is available now via the [book website](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/parallelstrokes.com/). It isn't officially being released for a week, but I figured Typophile readers should have a chance before other folks.

About Parallel Strokes:

[Parallel Strokes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/parallelstrokes.com/) is a collection of interviews with twenty-plus contemporary typeface designers, graffiti writers, and lettering artists around the world. The book is introduced with a comprehensive essay charting the history of graffiti, its relation to type design, and how the two practices relate in the wider context of lettering.  
Interviews within include conversations with pan-European type design collecitve [Underware](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3), Japanese type designer [Akira Kobayashi](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.linotype.com/), American graffiti writer and fine artist Barry McGee/Twist, German graffiti writers [Daim](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/edfella.com/) and [Seak](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/seakone.com/), American lettering artist, graphic designer and design eductor [Ed Fella](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/edfella.com/), among others. Parallel Strokes is an enquiry into the history, context, and development of lettering today, both culturally approved and illicit.

Full list of interviewees:

[Akira Kobayashi](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.linotype.com/)  
 [Underware](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3)  
 [Ed Fella](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/edfella.com/)  
 [Delta](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.deltainc.nl/indexdeltainc.html)  
 [Jerry Inscoe/Joker](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/jinscoe.com/)  
 [Jens Gehlhaar](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/brandnewschool.com/)  
 [Daim](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/daimgallery.com/)  
 [Seak](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/seakone.com/)  
 [Jonas Williamsson](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/reala.se/)  
 [Handselecta](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/handselecta.com/)  
 [Tauba Auerbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/taubaauerbach.com/)  
 [Lady Pink](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/taubaauerbach.com/)  
 [She One](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.blackatelier.com/)  
 [Eklips AWR/MSK](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/theseventhletterstore.com/)  
 [Eskae](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/ezrali.com/)  
 [Renos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.graffiti.org/renos/index.html)  
 [Mike Giant](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.mikegiant.com/)  
 [Chaz Bojorquez](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.kazemag.com/)  
 [Barry McGee/Twist](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_McGee)

The result of six years of research in the combined arts of lettering, graffiti, and typeface design, Parallel Strokes is a collection of interviews some of the best letterform creators in the world today.

[Chaz Bojorquez](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.kazemag.com/) talks about the origins of barrio graffiti in Los Angeles and the evolution of the craft. Fellow Angeleno, vernacular graphic designer E [d Fella](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/www.edfella.com/), speaks about his history in lettering and how he earned the title “The King of Zing” in Detroit design and illustration circles. Famed Japanese type designer [Akira Kobayashi](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/linotype.com/) discusses Roman and Japanese letterforms while showcasing a lifetime of type design work. European graffiti writers [Daim](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/daimgallery.com/), [Seak](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/seakone.com/), and [Delta](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/deltainc.com/) share their thoughts on dimensional graffiti lettering while American graffiti writer [Mike Giant](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/mikegiant.com/) talks about vernacular lettering, typeface design, and the evolution of graffiti handstyles.

[Parallel Strokes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/parallelstrokes.com/) is richly illustrated throughout, featuring copious previously unpublished work by the interviewed artists, as well as supplementary illustrations and photographs detailing contemporary and historical trends in graffiti and type design.

The first 100 orders come with a two color 17" x 20" Parallel Strokes poster printed using recycled paper and soy inks at Portland, Oregon's Pinball Publishing.

[Parallel Strokes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/parallelstrokes.com/) is 244 pages thick and available for [$20](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014011/http:/parallelstrokes.com/) with free shipping worldwide.
